main event: A report described multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects with various characteristics recorded in New York during December 1960.
interesting points: The first sighting reported red and green flashing lights moving erratically, resembling a balloon sized like a basketball., Another sighting involved a bright light hovering in the southeast sky around 11:30 PM, which suddenly accelerated and disappeared., A witness described an object with a size of approximately 6 to 8 feet in diameter, appearing silver or white, that emerged from a cloud bank., Observations noted varying conditions of the sky, including cloudless and bright hazy weather., The witness descriptions indicated a general expectation of the objects being aircraft, despite the erratic behavior and unusual appearances.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects showing lights and strange movements
witness description: An adult person of good judgment, likely reliable and observant
